briefdescription.para: Checks if the standard color space BT.2020 is supported on a display.

entry.para: The pointer to a variable where the state of color space CCIR2020 is returned. The variable is true if the color space CCIR2020 is supported. The variable is false if the color space CCIR2020 is not supported.

detaileddescription.para: If the state of color space CCIR2020 is successfully returned, ADLX_OK is returned. If the state of color space CCIR2020 is not successfully returned, an error code is returned. Refer to ADLX_RESULT for success codes and error codes.

ITU-R Recommendation BT.2020, is commonly known by the abbreviations Rec.2020 or BT.2020. It defines various aspects of Ultra-High-Definition Television (UHDTV) with Standard Dynamic Range (SDR) and Wide Color Gamut (WCG), including picture resolutions, frame rates with progressive scan, bit depths, color primaries, RGB, and luma-chroma color representations, chroma subsampling, and opto-electronic transfer function.
